content: twist the cast-on work k2 p2 rib for as many rounds as you would like your cuff to be i did 24 rounds for my sam- ple on my sample socks i actually worked the cuff over 80 sts and decreased down to 72 sts in the first plain k round if you have larger calves and/or don t like tight cuffs this may be an option to consider leg work the leg according to the chart the chart shows one half of the sock so work it twice once on each needle the red line indicates where i stopped the leg on my sample sock feel free to end after the second leaf border if you prefer a shorter sock equally feel free to work a longer leg but make sure you complete a full argyll diamond as this will look nicer at the back over the heel heel you will start the first heel row by working on the wrong side of needle 2 i have used the darker colour from the argyll pattern for the heel but you can work it in any colour you like do not break the yarn of the other colour i have used a size 2 5 mm for my heel the heel is worked over 35 sts which means you have 37 sts left for the instep this is done to centre the argyll design row1 sl1 p34 move the last remaining st on needle 2 onto needle 1 turn row2 sl1 k1 to last st k1 turn row3 sl1 p to end turn repeating the last 2 row work the heel flap for as long as you need it to be this depends on the height of your instep i did a total of 39 row for mine but you could work longer or shorter as long as your last row is a ws row having completed a ws row turn the heel as follows row1 sl1 k1 9 times ssk k1 turn leaving 14 sts unworked row2 sl1 p2 p2tog p1 turn again leaving 14 sts unworked row3 sl1 k to 1 st before gap ssk k1 turn row4 sl1 p to 1 st before gap p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 and 4 until you have used up all the sts either side you should be ready to work a k row with 19 sts on your needle k9 this is the centre back onopordum page 3 gusset if you have used a smaller needle for the heel change back to the size you have used for the leg using needle 1 k10 pick up and knit 1 st in each slipped stitch down the side of the heel flap you will pick up roundly half the number of row you knitted for my 39 row i picked up 20 sts if you have used one of the colours from the argyll check for the heel then the second colour should be waiting for you at this point
